topic.title: How does the zero net actualy work in regards to php and databases?
topic.body: So i do get that its basically torrent for websites, but wouldnt that mean that php code and databases are user readable?

topic.title: How does one deal with illegal content here?
topic.body:
Say someones a faggot and uploads cp. If i happen to download it, it gets shared from my computer, right? And if i dont notice it bunch of people can download it from me? So im a distrubutor at that point, arent i?

So what can i do to avoid such situation? Is it even encrypted or can everybody between me and the pedo see what is he sending to me? If somebody wanted to destroy the community, all he would have to do is to spam cp all over the place until everybody gets scared and leaves?

1552807915_1CBZY3cuYKeHZXEeHVxRFLmsCr3Um.body:
> [satoxyn1](#comment_11_1LGApmQZPN49nawg4HQQgf8ToVUPxGe2Zq): There's no "server side" (=php) code in ZeroNet, all user code is executed in browser and contain in .js files. The databases are user readable.

So things like private chats and such are impossible?

1561669750_1QH31dTs9gcggfUp7PvFkW7kPohhe.body:

Yeah but what if i dont notice the pedo

If somebody really wanted they can get me regardless of tor being used, not to mention that id be storing cp on my drive, so if my computer got seized for whatever reason im fucked

1565256550_149W17bFN1NbQou6iE81Uq2b8wEvy.body:
> [zerowatchdog](#comment_9_1CN9rdrWkKbk8EmDSQNZZrwGmd8TvVbgjM): Additionally, I would like to see a user ranking based on "likes", posts and/or relationship (trust level). Maybe something like https://steemit.com/faq.html#Does_it_cost_anything_to_post__comment__or_vote but without crypto money. As a result it could be a kind of social self-regulated ecosystem. Limits trolls and haters, supports ZeroNet to gain value by good content.

Thats actually not such a good idea. Having a plenty of experience from both reddit and various imageboards, i find the communities with a complete lack of any karma system much more honest and straightforward. Users there are not afraid to say what they think out of fear of losing goodboy points. Opinions and ideas flow much more freely. 

Yes, it does limit trolls and whatnot, it does bring its own set of issues however like karmawhoring and dissenting opinions being silenced by the sheer amount of downvotes leading to the platform devolving into a massive echo chamber and circlejerk.

Considering that 0net was made as an answer to the increasing amount of censorship, i think that this one should be passed on
I really like the imageboard format actually.  Maybe you could blur the thumbnails beyond the point of danger of getting into trouble for it. If it looks like porn, simply dont open it.

1565329400_194xi8BJsLXhwje1kBJETKo6tjvhH.body:
> [aspidochelone](#comment_23_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): Back in the 1990s, the Human Genome Project was going and everyone with any knowledge of genetics was pretty sure how it would go.  They would find that intelligence is a multifactorial inheritance like height, with many genes affecting it a little bit.  The frequencies of each form of each gene (allele) would be worked out in each racial population, and eventually it would be found that one race was statistically a little smarter than the other -- but then, of course, we would know that certain people in each race have larger genetic advantages or disadvantages. [...]

This really makes one think, though: where does intelligence come from then if not from the dna? Why is the black bell curve 15 full IQ pointsbehind the white one? The data doesnt lie. Id argue that its for the same reason that cats arent as smart as humans - they simply didnt evolve as much in the brain department. 

Humans left Africa more than 120k years ago. Thats more than enough time for natural selection to give us things like lactose tolerance, turn our skin completely pale, change our skull shape and so on. Is it such a strech to add some extra IQ points on average? 

Darwin teaches us that natural selection is driven by the pressure of the environment. So, wouldnt 120k years of harsher winters, scarcer food, less fertile ground and god knows what else lead to a superior human compared to those who lived on easy mode in subsaharan africa?
